intro: Cancrinia karataviensis, commonly known as the Karatavinskaya thistle, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellowish and arranged in a dense cluster. Cancrinia karataviensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
